metadata.Title: CVE-2015-2192 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.Description:
Integer overflow in the dissect_osd2_cdb_continuation function inepan/dissectors/packet-scsi-osd.c in the SCSI OSD dissector in Wireshark1.12.x before 1.12.4 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service(infinite loop) via a crafted length field in a packet.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-2192` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libwireshark-data - 1.10.6-1
libwireshark3 - 1.10.6-1
libwiretap3 - 1.10.6-1
libwsutil3 - 1.10.6-1
tshark - 1.10.6-1
wireshark - 1.10.6-1
wireshark-common - 1.10.6-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wireshark package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.10.6-1').
